results.title: Love streams
results.creator_credit: Cannon Group, Menahem Golan, Yoram Globus and John Cassavetes
results.brief_description: In Cassavetes’ films the meaning behind love, relationships and identity cannot be easily apprehended because characters are always placed in the thick of things. “Love Streams” is about a brother and sister with different approaches to love, who come together to ease each other’s trouble. Robert Harmon doesn’t know how to establish lines of communication with his son, girlfriend and ex-wife. On the other hand, his sister, Sarah Lawson, repels her daughter and husband with her obsessive love. In an early scene Sarah states to the court that “love is a continuous stream”. The saying informs the rest of the director’s work, where the characters’ personal dilemmas perpetuate their own life.

results.title: Love story = A Woman surrenders
results.creator_credit: Harold Huth, Gainsborough Pictures and Leslie Arliss
results.brief_description: Two people are drawn together in Cornwall during World War II by their shared misfortune. Lissa (Margaret Lockwood), a brilliant concert pianist suffering from a potentially fatal heart condition becomes romantically involved with engaged RAF pilot Kit (Stewart Granger), who is slowly going blind. Neither of the two knows of the predicament of the other, and keeps secret their personal drama. When Lissa learns of Kit’s blindness, she tries to convince him into having a dangerous and experimental operation to restore his sight. Conflict ensues when Lissa and Kit’s financee are at loggerheads as to whether Kit should have the surgery. Cast also includes Patricia Roc, Tom Walls and Reginald Purdell. Screenplay by Leslie Arliss and Doreen Montgomery from a short story by J. W. Drawbell. “Cornish rhapsody” composed by Hubert Bath, played by the National Symphony Orchestra and conducted by Sidney Beer. Solo pianoforte by Harriet Cohen.

results.title: Love story
results.creator_credit: Howard G. Minsky, Paramount Pictures and Arthur Hiller
results.brief_description: Eric Segal’s best-selling novel adapted for the silver screen, became one of the most famous and loved “tear jerkers” of cinema history. Starring Ali MacGraw and Ryan O’Neal, they play a young college couple, Jenny and Oliver. The story chronicles their love as they overcome the obstacles of different social status, their marriage and ultimate separation when death claims Jenny. Nominated for seven Academy Awards, the film co-stars Ray Milland and John Marley. The haunting theme song became a hit classic of the movies.

results.title: Love stories
results.brief_description: A series of short stories done in a combined animation/liveaction style. The stories include: “Blind Date”; “Love Fever”; “Brief Encounter”; “For Ever Yours”; “Femmes De Mode”; “A Question Of Style”.

results.title: Love song
results.creator_credit: Trilobite Productions, SBS Independent, Australian Film Commission, Film Victoria and Bruce Currie
results.brief_description: A crooning rat with an accoutrement of gifts tries to woo the lady of the lair - a cat no less. Will he succeed where others failed, thanks to his loving ballad? Sung by Paul Livingston.

results.title: Love on the wing
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit and Norman McLaren
results.brief_description: Continually metamorphosing symbols, drawn directly on 35mm film stock, move against multi-plane backgrounds. The film publicised the U.K. Air Mail service. Music by Jacques Ibert, camera by F. Gamagi.

results.title: Love on the run = L'Amour en fuite
results.creator_credit: AMLF, Films du Carrosse and Francois Truffaut
results.brief_description: Fifth and final installment of Francois Truffaut’s “Antoine Doinel” cycle. Largely a series of flashbacks, this episode sees Antoine about to be divorced, and hence, reflective about his life. He is in love with Sabine but is filled with conflict about his responsibilities, in particular, his son, and is introspective the about the past. Aboard a train Antoine meets up with former love, Colette, and although they initially recall the past fondly, she subsequently berates Antoine for his lack of maturity and enduring self-absorption. This bittersweet work was largely derided as a disappointing end to an iconic series, but it maintains the lyricism and comical whimsy that are signatures of Truffauts “Doinel” work, whilst also being the most mediative.

results.title: Love on a slice of bread = Cinta dalam sepotong roti
results.creator_credit: Budiyati Abiyoga, Prasidi Teta Film and Garin Nugroho
results.brief_description: Director Garin Nugroho’s first feature is the story of three childhood friends caught in a love triangle. Topan, a photographer, visits his childhood friends who have married each other. The three of them end up travelling to Lombok together, which proves to be not such a good idea. The husband is revealed to be sexually incompetent and he ends up having an affair with Topan’s photographic model (although to what extent remains unclear as the film was censored by the Indonesian Censorship Board). Meanwhile, Mayang finds out that she has more in common with Topan than her husband. This is arguably Nugroho’s most mainstream effort. Later on, he went on to develop his hallmark strengths - intricate cultural nuances, sparse dialogue and a sense of hightened realism. This film won Best Film at the Indonesian Film Festival in 1991 and Best young Director at the Asia-Pacific Film Festival in South Korea in the same year. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Love of static sound
results.brief_description: A range of visual treatments including image within image and beat mixed editing creates a seductive and culturally revealing music video clip. Two characters are depicted using a high impact visual style with an underlying narrative.
